page.title: 09POST OFFICE CONT.
page.content: The Post Office building is a wooden 10ft by 8ft garden shed. It provides enough room for a counter and a sorting table on which the mail can be put into bundles for delivery to the islanders. We receive four bags usually from Mallaig, Fort William and two from Glasgow. The main trade of the Post Office is stamps although other items such as postal orders, registered envelopes are stocked. As it is a non-cash account office it does not have services such as Giro bank, National Savings or Government Stock Bonds. The Post Office provides employment for an islander when the tendancy is to go to the mainland in search of work. The Post Office houses the library books, which are sent from the mainland every three months.
